page.title: 13History _ Leck area
page.content: {BRONTE COTTAGES}in Cowan Bridge was once the Clergy Daughters School founded in 1820 by the Vicar of Tunstall the Rev.W.C.Wilson. In 1824 Charlotte Bronte and her sisters became pupils. Her life there was reflected in the famous book "Jane Eyre". Next to Bronte Cottages was a Bobbin Mill. {HALLS}Whoop Hall was once called Upp Hall. It is called Upp because it is Upper to Burrow Hall.The first time it appears as Whoop Hall was in 1794 in Tunstall Church register. The reason for it being called Whoop Hall was that Mr.Christopher Picard kept a pack of hounds at his house in Cowan Bridge and the publican of that date thought that he would attract more custom by changing its name.Cowan Bridge has had different names, Collon Bridge,Collyn Bridge and finally Cowan Bridge.
